Description: Pottery unguentarium or flask in Plain White ware; elongated piriform body with a tall cylindrical neck, widening upwards to a chamfered rim; wide pedestal base with chamfered edges (not properly centred on the narrow lower end of the body); buff-pink clay with traces of lustrous bright red paint on the rim and along the neck; the surface of the lower body is heavily calcinated.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: See Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations. SCE IV/3, fig. 24, esp. 27-31 & p. 61 for comparable types.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
